newsitem.title: USA: Mass. House passes $18.3 bln FY'98 budget - report.
newsitem.headline: Mass. House passes $18.3 bln FY'98 budget - report.

text.p: The Massachusetts House of Representatives passed an $18.3 billion budget for the fiscal year beginning July 1 after approving on a voice vote a small tax cut, the State House News Service said.
The budget now heads to the Senate, which is expected to include more tax breaks in its spending plan.

House Speaker Thomas Finneran, D-Mattapan, after turning back six of the tax cuts proposed by Gov. William Weld, a Republican, allowed the seventh -- extending the sunset of the investment tax credit to July 1, 2000 -- which was adopted on a voice vote, the report said.
